response.answer_text: Gremlins (1984) The original creature is actually a Mogwai (which roughly translates to “demon” in Cantonese). He’s named Gizmo by the family that adopts/kidnaps him from an old Chinese antiques dealer. There are three rules that’s told about the care of these creatures: Rule #1: Keep them away from bright light. Sunlight will kill them.Rule #2: Don’t expose them to water. They multiply when wet.Rule #3: Don’t feed them after midnight, or they’ll evolve from Mogwai into Gremlins. Of course, all the rules are broken and we go from:  (Gizmo the Mogwai) . . . to. . .  (Stripe, leader of the Gremlins) There doesn’t seem to be any purpose for the Gremlins except to cause chaos and anarchy as they run rampant throughout the small town. It’s up to the Gizmo and his teenage friend to outwit the evil Gremlins and restore order to the community. No go watch the movies!
